references.paper_title: A simple framework for contrastive learning of visual representations
references.reason: This paper is foundational for contrastive learning, a widely used method in self-supervised learning, and its impact on the field is significant.

references.paper_title: Momentum contrast for unsupervised visual representation learning
references.reason: This paper introduces the MoCo method, a highly influential technique for contrastive learning that significantly improved the performance of self-supervised learning models.

references.paper_title: Unsupervised learning of visual features by contrasting cluster assignments
references.reason: This paper presents SwAV, a clustering-based contrastive learning approach that achieved state-of-the-art results on several image classification benchmarks.

references.paper_title: Unsupervised representation learning by predicting image rotations
references.reason: This paper introduced the concept of equivariant self-supervised learning, which is central to the main topic of the current paper.

references.paper_title: Equivariant self-supervised learning: Encouraging equivariance in representations
references.reason: This paper is among the first to explore the benefits of equivariant self-supervised learning, which directly inspired the current work.
